repnme.cdata!:
India - Andhra Pradesh Hazard Mitigation
            and Emergency Cyclone Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was unsatisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            unsatisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that combining
            long-term disaster mitigation activities management into a
            three year emergency reconstruction project proved to be
            unrealistic and contributed to the failure in completing
            some of the disaster mitigation activities within the
            expected timeframe. Early resolution is required on the
            institutional arrangements for a core institution with
            adequate capacity and power to take the lead in hazard
            mitigation activities. Adequacy of project preparation is
            crucial, and this should continue to be followed up
            rigorously during implementation period in the case of
            emergency operation. The Government of Andhra Pradesh
            (GoAP's) maintenance of cap on bid prices is
            inconsistent with Bank procurement rules, as it may result
            in rebidding, lack of credible response to bid invitations,
            bid rejections and delayed action, which in the end would
            hamper the quality of work. Efficient project management and
            delegation of full administrative and financial powers to
            implementing agency proved to be beneficial. Information
            dissemination, capacity building of the implementing
            agencies' staff and proper due diligence are crucial,
            particularly in complex, multi-sectoral projects.
            Establishment of a specialized maintenance wing within AP
            Transco and initiation of community involvement in
            maintenance proved to have considerably contributed to more
            trouble-free operation and strengthened maintenance.
            Extension to project implementation period provides the
            window of opportunity for remedial actions and should be
            followed up more rigorously during the extension period.
            Land acquisition and resettlement impacts need to be fully
            considered for implementation of infrastructure works.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Andhra Pradesh Hazard Mitigation
            and Emergency Cyclone Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Hazard Mitigation and
            Emergency Cyclone Recovery Project's objectives are (1)
            to help the state government prepare and implement a hazard
            management program in high risk areas, and restore public
            infrastructure lost last year, according to the
            hazard-resistant criteria for infrastructure sites,
            construction, and quality control; and (2) to enhance
            India's cyclone early warning capacity. The project
            will finance (1) a hazard management program promoting
            selected prevention, mitigation, and preparedness activities
            for water-related disasters; (2) the restoration of damaged
            public infrastructure, including irrigation drains and
            flood-banks, roads and bridges, public buildings, and
            mitigation works; and (3) technical assistance for project
            implementation and management, and financing for incremental
            operating costs on a declining scale.
